Curator's comments: See John Petherick, Egypt, the Soudan and Central Africa, 1861, p.394: (on the Djour) ‘Their left arms from the wrist to the elbow are covered closely with tight-fitting narrow iron bracelets kept bright. This kind of armour is much prized by them.’
Acquisition name: Donated by: Dr E A Crispin
Acquisition notes: Af1937,1109.1 to 25 were given by Dr E Crispin (see biography) and recorded in the register as "From the Shilluk, Dinka and Nuer tribes of the White Nile, Sudan". There is no recorded information about which object came from which group.
